column4: I live in australia, a bit out of the way, i'm not too worried about anybody hacking my wep at the moment, but is Ubuntu hard to set up for WPA? is it hardware dependant?
you can use wifi-radar which has an option for wpa
the good thing about wifi-radar is that it also runs as a daemon so it will connect to what it can automagically upon bootup
last time i tried wifi-radar it wouldn't let me connect at all, and seemed to cut off network-manager
